reviewText: Seem more like a play. Accents heavy hard to understand
Anna Maxwell Martin has turned out to be my favorite actress.  I could watch her all day.  She is truly amazing!  Movie was well done but just a bit short from being a classic, imo.
Terrific acting, great story.  I'll watch most anything that Anna Maxwell Martin is in, and she really delivers.

yikes, quite poignant but disturbing.  G8888T acting.  I think I'd better read the book cuz there are some holes that needs to be filled.  I don't understand what make Poppy become a "nutter" from a sane person.  Mmmmm.
Tedious to watch but interesting because there was a star in the movie before she became a star. She had a minor role.
This story was so heart wrenching. The acting was very good; but the story of how deceptive people can get with one another over money and position is so disturbing.
I read the book, then watched the movie.  It stuck close to the original story and was heartbreaking.  Poor Poppy.

Brilliantly acted, and such a poignant, thought provoking portrayal of the handling of mental health issues. I saw this on Hulu, and am a little shocked that this is priced so high.  It's definitely worth seeing, but not at almost $50.

After Last King of ScotlandI was prepared for some "simply simple" with a twist, and this low budget movie really met expectations. Of mental health institutional abuse grounding the modern UK's very functioning as ones could see from Australia a thorough Mother-country follower in social engineering etc., a story tells about two she-Brits, Caucasian and Afro, and their ways to a better life closed subtly by feasting on others' hardness arranged artificially too frequently, intentionally. It is not so simple movie also has been presented with a lovely understandable natural accent, not much characters' lines to follow.
